nodes.object_title: Probability and Linear Algebra for Machine Learning
nodes.raw_text: Probability and Linear Algebra for Machine Learning. This course provides the mathematical underpinnings required for modern ML. Students will learn the fundamentals of probability theory, including conditional probabilities and Bayes’ theorem, linear algebra concepts like eigenvalues and singular value decomposition, and optimization approaches for parameter estimation. Emphasis is on building the intuition needed to apply these methods in later ML courses.

page_profile.name_en_value: Probability and Linear Algebra for Machine Learning
page_profile.description_short_en_value: Course about probability theory, linear algebra, optimization
page_profile.description_medium_en_value: Introduction to the key mathematical tools needed for ML. Focus on probability distributions, vector spaces, and optimization methods.
page_profile.description_long_en_value: This course provides the mathematical underpinnings required for modern ML. Students will learn the fundamentals of probability theory, including conditional probabilities and Bayes’ theorem, linear algebra concepts like eigenvalues and singular value decomposition, and optimization approaches for parameter estimation. Emphasis is on building the intuition needed to apply these methods in later ML courses.

nodes.raw_text: Statistical Inference and Modeling. Students explore the central ideas of statistical inference, including point estimation, confidence intervals, and hypothesis testing. The course emphasizes modeling strategies and how to apply inference techniques in practice, preparing students for the statistical thinking required in data-driven ML projects.

page_profile.description_short_en_value: Course about hypothesis testing, estimation, confidence intervals
page_profile.description_medium_en_value: Covers the foundations of statistical inference relevant for ML applications.
page_profile.description_long_en_value: Students explore the central ideas of statistical inference, including point estimation, confidence intervals, and hypothesis testing. The course emphasizes modeling strategies and how to apply inference techniques in practice, preparing students for the statistical thinking required in data-driven ML projects.

nodes.raw_text: Foundations of Optimization. Optimization is at the heart of machine learning. This course introduces key optimization concepts, including convexity, duality, and first-order methods such as gradient descent. Students learn both the theoretical guarantees and practical trade-offs of different algorithms. Applications will include regression, classification, and neural network training.

page_profile.description_short_en_value: Course about convex optimization, gradient descent, convergence
page_profile.description_medium_en_value: Introduction to optimization methods central to ML. Covers convex optimization, gradient-based algorithms, and convergence analysis.
page_profile.description_long_en_value: Optimization is at the heart of machine learning. This course introduces key optimization concepts, including convexity, duality, and first-order methods such as gradient descent. Students learn both the theoretical guarantees and practical trade-offs of different algorithms. Applications will include regression, classification, and neural network training.

nodes.raw_text: Introduction to Machine Learning. This course introduces the fundamental principles of machine learning, focusing on supervised and unsupervised learning paradigms. Students learn about core concepts such as the bias-variance tradeoff, cross-validation, and model evaluation metrics. Practical sessions emphasize implementing algorithms and evaluating their performance on real-world datasets.

page_profile.description_short_en_value: Course about supervised learning, unsupervised learning, evaluation metrics
page_profile.description_medium_en_value: Core introduction to machine learning principles with hands-on practice.
page_profile.description_long_en_value: This course introduces the fundamental principles of machine learning, focusing on supervised and unsupervised learning paradigms. Students learn about core concepts such as the bias-variance tradeoff, cross-validation, and model evaluation metrics. Practical sessions emphasize implementing algorithms and evaluating their performance on real-world datasets.

nodes.raw_text: Principles of Learning from Data. Students learn how to analyze datasets using regression, classification, and clustering techniques. The course blends theory with practice, introducing real-world data applications and teaching the strengths and limitations of different learning paradigms. Programming labs reinforce algorithmic intuition.

page_profile.description_short_en_value: Course about regression, classification, clustering
page_profile.description_medium_en_value: Practical introduction to learning from structured data.
page_profile.description_long_en_value: Students learn how to analyze datasets using regression, classification, and clustering techniques. The course blends theory with practice, introducing real-world data applications and teaching the strengths and limitations of different learning paradigms. Programming labs reinforce algorithmic intuition.

nodes.raw_text: Applied Machine Learning Fundamentals. This course bridges theory and practice in ML. Students explore the bias-variance tradeoff, model validation strategies, and error analysis. The emphasis is on designing robust experiments and critically interpreting results. Hands-on labs use real-world datasets to practice building reliable models.

page_profile.description_short_en_value: Course about bias-variance, model validation, error analysis
page_profile.description_medium_en_value: An applied approach to core ML methods and evaluation.
page_profile.description_long_en_value: This course bridges theory and practice in ML. Students explore the bias-variance tradeoff, model validation strategies, and error analysis. The emphasis is on designing robust experiments and critically interpreting results. Hands-on labs use real-world datasets to practice building reliable models.

nodes.raw_text: Linear Models in Data Science. This course introduces students to linear regression, logistic regression, and generalized linear models (GLMs). Students gain experience in interpreting coefficients, handling categorical predictors, and understanding model assumptions. Applications range from predicting continuous outcomes to binary classification tasks in ML contexts.

page_profile.description_short_en_value: Course about linear regression, logistic regression, GLMs
page_profile.description_medium_en_value: Explores linear models as the backbone of applied statistics and ML.
page_profile.description_long_en_value: This course introduces students to linear regression, logistic regression, and generalized linear models (GLMs). Students gain experience in interpreting coefficients, handling categorical predictors, and understanding model assumptions. Applications range from predicting continuous outcomes to binary classification tasks in ML contexts.

nodes.raw_text: Regularization Techniques in Machine Learning. Students learn about the role of regularization in improving generalization performance. Topics include ridge regression, lasso, and elastic net. Case studies highlight their importance in high-dimensional datasets, variable selection, and model interpretability. Both theoretical insights and applied practice are emphasized.

page_profile.description_short_en_value: Course about ridge regression, lasso, elastic net
page_profile.description_medium_en_value: Focuses on regularization methods to prevent overfitting.
page_profile.description_long_en_value: Students learn about the role of regularization in improving generalization performance. Topics include ridge regression, lasso, and elastic net. Case studies highlight their importance in high-dimensional datasets, variable selection, and model interpretability. Both theoretical insights and applied practice are emphasized.

nodes.raw_text: Maximum Likelihood and Linear Prediction. This course situates linear regression within the framework of maximum likelihood estimation. Students learn how linear predictors arise as optimal estimators under specific assumptions. The course also covers prediction error decomposition and model assessment, providing a deeper statistical understanding of regression modeling.

page_profile.description_short_en_value: Course about maximum likelihood, regression, prediction error
page_profile.description_medium_en_value: Examines linear models from a probabilistic perspective.
page_profile.description_long_en_value: This course situates linear regression within the framework of maximum likelihood estimation. Students learn how linear predictors arise as optimal estimators under specific assumptions. The course also covers prediction error decomposition and model assessment, providing a deeper statistical understanding of regression modeling.

nodes.raw_text: Decision Trees and Applications. Decision trees are a cornerstone of interpretable machine learning. This course covers classification and regression trees, pruning methods to prevent overfitting, and practical applications in domains ranging from business to healthcare. Students will implement tree-based models and learn how to evaluate their performance against other algorithms.

page_profile.description_short_en_value: Course about classification trees, regression trees, pruning
page_profile.description_medium_en_value: Introduces decision trees as interpretable ML models with broad applications.
page_profile.description_long_en_value: Decision trees are a cornerstone of interpretable machine learning. This course covers classification and regression trees, pruning methods to prevent overfitting, and practical applications in domains ranging from business to healthcare. Students will implement tree-based models and learn how to evaluate their performance against other algorithms.

nodes.raw_text: Ensemble Learning. This course explores how combining multiple models leads to stronger predictive performance. Topics include bagging, random forests, and boosting methods such as AdaBoost, XGBoost, and LightGBM. Students gain experience in applying ensembles to structured data problems and learn about the trade-offs between accuracy and interpretability.

page_profile.description_short_en_value: Course about bagging, random forests, boosting
page_profile.description_medium_en_value: Focuses on ensemble techniques to improve predictive accuracy.
page_profile.description_long_en_value: This course explores how combining multiple models leads to stronger predictive performance. Students gain experience in applying ensembles to structured data problems and learn about the trade-offs between accuracy and interpretability.

nodes.raw_text: Advanced Tree-Based Methods. Students learn advanced tree-based algorithms with a focus on gradient boosting and its variations. The course also emphasizes feature importance, SHAP values, and model interpretability. Case studies from real-world data demonstrate the power of ensemble methods in domains such as finance, healthcare, and natural sciences.

page_profile.description_short_en_value: Course about gradient boosting, feature importance, interpretability

nodes.raw_text: Support Vector Machines. This course covers the foundations of support vector machines, focusing on the principle of margin maximization for classification. Students will explore kernel methods for nonlinear decision boundaries, soft margin classification for noisy data, and applications of SVMs in image recognition and text classification.

page_profile.description_short_en_value: Course about margin maximization, kernels, classification
page_profile.description_medium_en_value: Introduces the theory and practice of SVMs for classification tasks.
page_profile.description_long_en_value: This course covers the foundations of support vector machines, focusing on the principle of margin maximization for classification. Students will explore kernel methods for nonlinear decision boundaries, soft margin classification for noisy data, and applications of SVMs in image recognition and text classification.

nodes.raw_text: Kernel Methods in Machine Learning. This course provides a deep dive into kernel methods, focusing on the mathematical properties of reproducing kernel Hilbert spaces. Students learn about the kernel trick for nonlinear feature mapping, kernelized algorithms such as SVMs and PCA, and applications in high-dimensional data analysis.

page_profile.description_short_en_value: Course about kernel tricks, nonlinear learning, dimensionality
page_profile.description_medium_en_value: Explores kernel-based approaches for nonlinear ML problems.
page_profile.description_long_en_value: This course provides a deep dive into kernel methods, focusing on the mathematical properties of reproducing kernel Hilbert spaces. Students learn about the kernel trick for nonlinear feature mapping, kernelized algorithms such as SVMs and PCA, and applications in high-dimensional data analysis.

nodes.raw_text: Nonlinear Classification Techniques. Students learn how nonlinear relationships in data can be modeled using advanced methods. Topics include kernel SVMs, kernel PCA, and manifold learning approaches such as Isomap and t-SNE. Practical applications emphasize text, image, and biological datasets where linear methods fail.

page_profile.description_short_en_value: Course about SVMs, kernel PCA, manifold learning
page_profile.description_medium_en_value: Focuses on nonlinear classification methods beyond linear boundaries.

Topics include kernel SVMs, kernel PCA, and manifold learning approaches such as Isomap and t-SNE. Practical applications emphasize text, image, and biological datasets where linear methods fail.

nodes.raw_text: Introduction to Neural Networks. This course covers the history and foundations of neural networks. Students explore perceptrons, multilayer feedforward networks, and the backpropagation algorithm. The course includes both mathematical derivations and hands-on implementation in Python frameworks such as TensorFlow or PyTorch.

page_profile.description_short_en_value: Course about perceptrons, feedforward nets, backpropagation

nodes.raw_text: Deep Learning Fundamentals. Students learn about deep neural networks, optimization algorithms such as SGD and Adam, and regularization techniques like dropout and batch normalization. The course emphasizes practical model building, tuning, and evaluation on image and text datasets. Ethical considerations and model limitations are also discussed.

This advanced course focuses on optimization in deep learning, covering gradient-based methods, adaptive algorithms such as Adam and RMSprop, and the geometry of loss landscapes. Students experiment with convergence behavior, learning rate schedules, and training stability in large-scale neural models.

Students learn about convolutional and pooling layers, architectures such as AlexNet, ResNet, and EfficientNet, and applications in image recognition, object detection, and medical imaging. nodes.raw_text: Recurrent Neural Networks. Students explore recurrent architectures including vanilla RNNs, long short-term memory (LSTM) networks, and gated recurrent units (GRUs). page_profile.description_short_en_value: Course about RNNs, LSTMs, GRUs

nodes.raw_text: Natural Language Processing. This course covers fundamental NLP techniques including tokenization, word embeddings, and sequence models. Students learn to build text classifiers, sentiment analyzers, and language models. Labs include hands-on projects with real-world corpora.

nodes.raw_text: Unsupervised Learning.
